trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_SEQ_00<tab>Erenville regards the pile of timber with undisguised weariness.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_SEQ_01<tab>Rather than remain idle, Erenville suggests moving the timber somewhere more easily accessible. You brace your back and prepare for a little heavy lifting.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_SEQ_02<tab>With a heave and a ho, you take up a crate full to bursting with timber. Thankfully the main road is not terribly far.

TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_SEQ_03<tab>No sooner do you set down the last of the timber than Wawlika arrives with Shenza, Zawpya, and a rroneek in tow. They insist you go and wait at the train station while they see to the timber's delivery.

TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_SEQ_04<tab>Erenville welcomes you back to the station, hopeful that you have had your fill of the sights of Shaaloani. He invites you to wait with him and watch the train as it departs.

TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_SEQ_05<tab>The skies over Shaaloani suddenly grow dark, and with a thunderous boom a giant dome appears in the distance. A moment later, flying warships emerge from its murky depths, and upon realizing that they are heading for Tuliyollal, you and Erenville hasten back to the capital. You arrive in a city embroiled in chaos, with mysterious soldiers in the streets slaughtering innocents seemingly at random. Once reunited with Wuk Lamat, the Dawnservant explains that the enemy forces appeared out of nowhere and attacked without provocation. Together with Erenville, the three of you make your way towards the palace, and there find Gulool Ja Ja locked in mortal combat with a transformed Zoraal Ja. The hardened warrior proves no match for his father, but through the use of an unknown power, he not only revives himself, but manages to deal Gulool Ja Ja a fatal blow.
※In the event that you leave the area and wish to return, speak with the Landsguard gatekeeper at the entrance to Sunperch.

TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_SEQ_06<tab>A hush falls over the throne room as all present realize Gulool Ja Ja is moments from his end. It remains to be seen if aught can be done to save the former Dawnservant...
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_TODO_00<tab>Pick up the crate of rough-cut timber.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_TODO_01<tab>Carry the crate of rough-cut timber to the designated location.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_TODO_02<tab>Speak with Erenville.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Erenville.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_TODO_04<tab>Speak with Wuk Lamat.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_HHWATO_000_000<tab>We must talk again soon. Next time, perhaps, on a hunt together.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_SHEPETTO_100_000<tab>You'll come back, won't you? There's so much I'd like to know about the lands beyond Tural.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_ERENVILLE_000_001<tab>While we wait, we could get started moving the timber somewhere more accessible.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_ERENVILLE_000_002<tab>It shouldn't take long if we split the work.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_SYSTEM_000_003<tab>Deliver the crate of timber to the main road.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_SYSTEM_000_004<tab>You will have two minutes to complete the task. Should you fail, return to the starting location and begin anew.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_ERENVILLE_000_010<tab>What are a few logs compared to the nigh-countless crates of Labyrinthos.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_SYSTEM_000_020<tab>Carry the timber from Mehwahhetsoan to the main road.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_ERENVILLE_100_020<tab>I should think this will be enough.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_WAWLIKA_000_021<tab>That was mighty kind of you to move all that lumber. Sorry we didn't make it back sooner.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_WAWLIKA_000_022<tab>We'll see to the rest.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_SHENZA_000_023<tab>Once we've repaired the tracks, we'll have you on the first train out of town. Ain't that right, chief?
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_WAWLIKA_000_024<tab>Er... As much as I'd love to make it so, there aren't any spots available.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_WAWLIKA_000_025<tab>You'll have to wait for the one after, I'm afraid, but you'll be riding free of charge. It's the least we can do to repay your kindness.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_ERENVILLE_000_026<tab>That's fine. Namikka and no few others were here long before we arrived. It's only right they go before us.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_WAWLIKA_000_027<tab>I hope you'll stop by and see the train off.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_WAWLIKA_000_028<tab>It's a breathtaking sight, let me tell you!
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_SHENZA_000_029<tab>And Nitowikwe will be driving! No engineer compares to her, and it's always a treat to watch her work!
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_ZAWPYA_000_030<tab>The only work we should be worried about is our own, Shenza. And we've still more to do.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_ERENVILLE_000_031<tab>I'll find somewhere quiet near the station to pass the time. If there's anything else in Shaaloani you're keen to see, I'll leave you to it.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_WAWLIKA_000_033<tab>My thanks again for your timely assistance. Won't be long now before the tracks are fixed and you're on your way.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_SHENZA_000_035<tab>It'll be good to have the train running again. I missed the sound of her barreling down the tracks.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_ZAWPYA_000_037<tab>We'll handle the rest of the work from here. You just sit tight now!
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_ERENVILLE_000_040<tab>Had your fill of the sights? Well, they appear to have almost finished...
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_SYSTEM_000_041<tab>Upon proceeding, several cutscenes will play in sequence.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_SYSTEM_000_042<tab>It is recommended that you set aside sufficient time to view these scenes in their entirety.
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_SYSTEM_000_043<tab>Wait for the train to depart from the station?
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_WUKLAMAT_000_060<tab>No... Papa can't die... He can't...
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_SUNPERCHGATEKEEPER_000_100<tab>Do you have business at Sunperch?
TEXT_KINGMD108_04919_SYSTEM_000_101<tab>Enter Sunperch?
